intro: Heterocondylus pandurifolius, commonly known as the pandurifoliate fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive fronds that are divided into lanceolate segments, giving it a unique appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its rhizomes are creeping and produce roots that help anchor it to the substrate. The leaves are usually evergreen, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
